org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.axis
Class ValueAxis

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.axis.ValueAxis
Direct Known Subclasses:
DateAxis, LegendAxis, OverviewAxis, RangeAxis
public abstract class ValueAxis
extends java.lang.Object

An ValueAxis is a class responsible for mapping points in data space to points in screen space, as well as maintaining state related to drawing axis ticks and labels. A given axis may be horizontal or vertical in orientation depending on the AxisPanel it is placed into, and rendered on the left/right or top/bottom depending on the AxisPanel position as well.

In GSS, an ValueAxis may be referred to using a CSS selector 'axis'. Each axis is numbered, can have several CSS classes, depending on subtypes, like "axis.range" or "axis.domain". See AxisRenderer for more details.

See Also:
AxisRenderer

public abstract double dataToUser(double dataValue)
Maps a given dataValue in the interval [rangeLow, rangeHigh] to a a user position in the range [0,1]

dataValue - the value to be mapped

drawAxis

public abstract void drawAxis(XYPlot plot,
                              Layer layer,
                              Bounds axisBounds,
                              boolean gridOnly)
Draws the axis into the given layer, within the specified axisBounds, as well as drawing grid-lines on the given DefaultXYPlot.

Parameters:
plot - the plot to draw the gridlines into
layer - the layer to render the axis on
axisBounds - the bounds within the layer into which the axis should be drawn
gridOnly - if true, only render gridlines into the plots, render nothing else
